alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued February 01 at 3:36AM HST until February 02 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM WEDNESDAY MORNING... .A west northwest swell arriving this morning will generate surf above advisory threshold by this afternoon along exposed shores of most of the smaller islands. Surf heights should decrease below advisory threshold along these shores Wednesday morning. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Surf heights building to 14 to 18 feet along north facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai and Maui. Surf heights building to 10 to 14 feet along west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu and Molokai. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu and Molokai as well as north facing shores of Maui. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Expect strong breaking waves, shore break, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult and dangerous.
info.instruction: Beachgoers, swimmers, and surfers should heed all advice given by ocean safety officials and exercise caution.
